title: calculate total pay with Employee class

content.description: Consider the following class definition. Each object of the class Employee will store the employeeâ€™s name as name, the number of weekly hours worked as wk_hours, and hourly rate of pay as pay_rate.
content.question: public class Employee{private String name;private int wk_hours;private double pay_rate;public Employee(String nm, int hrs, double rt){name = nm;wk_hours = hrs;pay_rate = rt;}public Employee(String nm, double rt){name = nm;wk_hours = 20;pay_rate = rt;}}Which of the following code segments, found in a class other than Employee, could be used to correctly create an Employee object representing an employee who worked for 20 hours at a rate of $18.50 per hour?I.Employee e1 = new Employee("Lili", 20, 18.5);II.Employee e2 = new Employee("Steve", 18.5);III.Employee e3 = new Employee("Carol", 20);

skill.text: 2.B: Write program code involving data abstractions.
